questions.question: 1. Which is true for uniaxial tensile engineering stress-strain curve of a polycrystalline aluminum?

answers.a: The curve goes up till yield point and then goes down till fracture
answers.b: Yield strength is higher than ultimate tensile strength
answers.d: The maximum stress is called ultimate tensile strength

questions.question: 2. Which is true for uniaxial tensile engineering stress-strain curve of a polycrystalline metal?

answers.a: The toughness of metal is typically higher than ceramics
answers.b: The toughness of metal is typically lower than ceramics
answers.c: After necking, the deformation is uniform throughout the gauge section
answers.d: Before necking, the deformation is non-uniform throughout the gauge section

questions.question: 3. Which of the following material will not show necking?
4. “Cold drawing” is associated with which of the following material during stress-strain curve?
5. Which one of the following will typically exhibit lowest strain to failure in stress-strain curve?
